Race.SpecificTitle: Recreation Dist. No. 6 -- 10 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
RECREATION DISTRICT NO. 6 PROPOSITION
(MILLAGE)

SUMMARY:  AUTHORITY FOR RECREATION DISTRICT NO. 6 OF THE PARISH OF TERREBONNE, STATE OF LOUISIANA, TO LEVY A 10 YEAR 10-MILLS TAX FOR THE PURPOSE OF ACQUIRING, CONSTRUCTING, IMPROVING, MAINTAINING AND OPERATING RECREATION FACILITIES FOR SAID DISTRICT, INCLUDING THE PURCHASE OF EQUIPMENT THEREFOR, SAID TAX TO BE IN LIEU OF THE SIMILAR 8 MILLS TAX AUTHORIZED AT A SPECIAL ELECTION HELD ON NOVEMBER 2, 2004.
Race.FullText: Shall Recreation District No. 6 of the Parish of Terrebonne, State of Louisiana (the "District"), levy and collect a special tax of ten (10) mills on all property subject to taxation in said District (an estimated $312,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2008 and ending with the year 2017, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining and operating recreation facilities for said District, including the purchase of equipment therefor, said tax to be in lieu of the similar 8 mills tax authorized at a special election held on November 2, 2004?

Race.SpecificTitle: Recreation Dist. No. 6 -- $1,400,000 Bond - BOC - 20 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
RECREATION DISTRICT NO. 6 PROPOSITION
(BOND)

SUMMARY:  AUTHORITY TO ISSUE $1,400,000 OF 20 YEAR GENERAL OBLIGATION BONDS OF RECREATION DISTRICT NO. 6 FOR PURCHASING, ACQUIRING, CONSTRUCTING AND IMPROVING PARKS, PLAYGROUNDS, RECREATION CENTERS AND OTHER RECREATIONAL FACILITIES, TOGETHER WITH THE NECESSARY FURNISHINGS AND EQUIPMENT THEREFOR, TITLE TO WHICH SHALL BE IN THE PUBLIC, SAID BONDS TO BE PAYABLE FROM AD VALOREM TAXES.
Race.FullText: Shall Recreation District No. 6 of the Parish of Terrebonne, State of Louisiana (the "District"), incur debt and issue bonds to the amount of One Million Four Hundred Thousand Dollars ($1,400,000), to run twenty (20) years from the date thereof, with interest at a rate or rates not exceeding seven percent (7%) per annum to be sold at par, premium or discount, for the purpose of purchasing, acquiring, constructing and improving parks, playgrounds, recreation centers and other recreational facilities, together with the necessary furnishings and equipment therefor, title to which shall be in the public, which bonds will be general obligations of the District and will be payable from ad valorem taxes to be levied and collected in the manner provided by Article VI, Section 33 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974, and statutory authority supplemental thereto?
